resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Jean Hess (1862-1926)

He was a journalist and explorator. He specializing in journalistic reporting on French Guiana and Devil's Island in the A. Dreyfus Affair.
resource.chars:
Jean Hess (1862-1926)

He was a journalist and explorator. He specializing in journalistic reporting on French Guiana and Devil's Island in the A. Dreyfus Affair.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The Jean Hess' photos highlighted the erroneus position of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devil%27s_Island" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Devil's Island on the maritime maps of the time. The position of Devil's Island was corrected.
resource.chars: The Jean Hess' photos highlighted the erroneus position of Devil's Island on the maritime maps of the time. The position of Devil's Island was corrected.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Le Monde illustré was an leading illustrated newspaper in France at the end of the 19th century. It was in competition with L’Illustration.
resource.chars: Le Monde illustré was an leading illustrated newspaper in France at the end of the 19th century. It was in competition with L’Illustration.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: At the end of the 19th century, journalistic reporting appeared. The Alfred Dreyfus Affair was one of the first events which received a significant media coverage. Jean Hess described as precisely as possible the conditions of A. Dreyfus’ detention. Photographs and drawings made by Jean Hess revealed some modifications made to the detention's regime of Alfred Dreyfus decided during the trial. The governor of Cayenne was afraid that Alfred Dreyfus would escape.
resource.chars: At the end of the 19th century, journalistic reporting appeared. The Alfred Dreyfus Affair was one of the first events which received a significant media coverage. Jean Hess described as precisely as possible the conditions of A. Dreyfus’ detention. Photographs and drawings made by Jean Hess revealed some modifications made to the detention's regime of Alfred Dreyfus decided during the trial. The governor of Cayenne was afraid that Alfred Dreyfus would escape.
